meanings.definition: A person or thing that reeks.
meanings.sent1: The garbage can was a real reeker after sitting in the sun all day.
meanings.sent2: The skunk was a notorious reeker in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The reeker of the group was the old cheese left in the fridge for too long.
meanings.sent4: The reeker in the room was so overpowering, it felt like a physical presence.
meanings.sent5: The reeker from the gym bag was so strong, it could be smelled from across the room.

meanings.sent1: The reeker of rotten eggs filled the kitchen after the gas leak.
meanings.sent2: The reeker of fish lingered in the air long after the market closed.
meanings.sent3: The reeker from the sewer grate made everyone hold their noses as they passed by.
meanings.sent4: The reeker of failure hung heavy in the room after the test results were announced.
meanings.sent5: The reeker of burnt popcorn wafted through the office, causing everyone to cough.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage began to reeker after being left out in the heat.
meanings.sent2: The flowers reekered of decay as they wilted in the vase.
meanings.sent3: The socks in the locker room reekered so badly, they could walk themselves to the laundry.
meanings.sent4: The dumpster behind the restaurant reekered so strongly, it could be smelled from the street.
meanings.sent5: The skunk reekered so intensely that even the bravest animals kept their distance.
